newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PLDT props up Manila shares at close.
newsitem.headline: PLDT props up Manila shares at close.

text.p: Manila shares closed firmer on Friday following a sharp rise in Philippine Long Distance Telephone Co and the improved exports figure, traders said.
"It was largely due to PLDT's climb. Many investors viewed it as the best hedge against a possible peso depreciation," said one broker from a foreign house.

PLDT was the most active issue, closing 60 pesos up at its intra-day peak of 930 pesos. The last time the stock reached that level was in July 1995. Others said PLDT's sharp rise in New York by $1 1/4 tp $65 3/8 led to its gains on the local bourse.
The main index ended 16.54 points up at 2,758.96
